com.smartnsoft.droid4me.support.v4.app

Class SmartListViewFragment<AggregateClass,ListViewClass extends android.view.ViewGroup>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.support.v4.app.SmartFragment<AggregateClass>
        • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.support.v4.app.SmartListViewFragment<AggregateClass,ListViewClass>
  • Type Parameters:
    AggregateClass - the aggregate class accessible though the SmartFragment.setAggregate(Object) and SmartFragment.getAggregate() methods
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic, Smartable<AggregateClass>, Smarted<AggregateClass>, DetailsProvider.ForList<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>,android.view.View>, DetailsProvider.ForListHandler<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>>, DetailsProvider.ForListView<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>,android.view.View>, LifeCycle, WrappedListView.OnEventObjectListener<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>>
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class SmartListViewFragment<AggregateClass,ListViewClass extends android.view.ViewGroup>
extends SmartFragment<AggregateClass>
implements DetailsProvider.ForList<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>,android.view.View>, WrappedListView.OnEventObjectListener<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>>
    A basis class for designing an Android compatibility library Fragment compatible with the framework, i.e. droid4me-ready.

    Warning: this class is only available for applications running under Android v1.6+, i.e. API level 4+, with the Android Support Package!

    Since:
    2011.12.14
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

      • onRetrieveDisplayObjects

        public void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where the derived class should set its layout, extract all widgets which require a further customization and store them as instance attributes. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        The method is invoked:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity#onCreate() execution, after the parent Activity#onCreate() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment#onCreate() execution, after the parent Fragment#onCreate() method has been invoked.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onRetrieveDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • isEnabled

        public final boolean isEnabled(SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?> businessViewWrapper)

        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface DetailsProvider.ForListHandler<SmartAdapters.BusinessViewWrapper<?>>
        Returns:
        true if the business object is enabled (can be selected)

      • onRetrieveBusinessObjects

        public final void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
                                     throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where to load the business objects, from memory, local persistence, via web services, necessary for the entity processing.

        If the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this callback will be invoked from a background thread, and not the UI thread. This method will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully retrieved its display objects, and every time the LifeCycle.refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked.

        When the method is invoked the first time, if the entity does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, its execution will occur:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity.onResume() execution, after the parent Activity.onResume() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment.onResume() execution, after the parent Fragment.onResume() method has been invoked.
        When the method is invoked the first time, if the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, it is ensured that this method will be invoked at least after the entity onResume() execution has started.

        It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread: if the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, it is ensured to be invoked from a background thread, otherwise, it is ensured to be invoked from the UI thread.

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onRetrieveBusinessObjects in interface LifeCycle
        Throws:
        LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException - if the extraction of the business objects was a failure and that this issue cannot be recovered, this enables to notify the framework that the current entity cannot continue its execution

      • onBusinessObjectsRetrieved

        public final void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: SmartFragment
        Own implementation.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        onBusinessObjectsRetrieved in class SmartFragment<AggregateClass>

      • onFulfillDisplayObjects

        public void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where the implementing class can initialize the previously retrieved graphical objects. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        If the entity does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, the method is invoked during the:

        1. Activity.onResume() execution for the Activity, after the parent Activity.onResume() method has been invoked,
        2. Fragment.onResume() execution for the Fragment, after the parent Fragment.onResume() method has been invoked.
        If the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked just after the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method first invocation has successfully returned.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onFulfillDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • onSynchronizeDisplayObjects

        public void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This method is supposed to update the display objects that may need some refreshing due to the underlying business objects that may have changed. It will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully fulfilled its display objects, and every time the LifeCycle.refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked, provided the previous LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() callback has successfully executed.

        When the method is invoked the first time, it will be called just after the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() callback execution.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onSynchronizeDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • notifyBusinessObjectsChanged

        public final void notifyBusinessObjectsChanged(boolean businessObjectCountAndSortingUnchanged)
        Deprecated. 
        Call this method when you want the list display to be recomputed because its underlying business object list has changed.
        Parameters:
        businessObjectCountAndSortingUnchanged - set to true when either the business objects count and order have been unchanged, and just the data changed

      • refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

        public void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean retrieveBusinessObjects,
                                    java.lang.Runnable onOver,
                                    boolean immediately)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        Asks the implementing entity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display. The method invokes the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method and then, provided the previous call was successful, the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method.

        It must be invoked only from the UI thread, if the current interface does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface.

        Specified by:
        refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay in interface LifeCycle
        Overrides:
        refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay in class SmartFragment<AggregateClass>
        Parameters:
        retrieveBusinessObjects - indicates whether the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method should be invoked or not
        onOver - if not null, this method will be eventually invoked from the UI thread, once the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method execution has successfully completed
        immediately - if this flag is set to true, even if the implementing entity is not currently displayed, the execution will be run at once. If set to false, the execution will be delayed until the entity (Activity.onResume() for the Activity, Fragment.onResume() for the Fragment method is invoked
